column4: or can someone tell me what the error iptables: No chain/target/match by that name. means?
Where do you see that message?
im trying to redirect dns request to the tor dnslistener using this iptables rule: iptables -t nat -D OUTPUT -d remote_dns_ip -p udp --dport 53 -j DNAT --to remote_dns_ip:5353
is there anything wrong with this rule
I think you need to change the command to suit your needs. Where it says remote_dns_ip, you need to change this and OUTPUT to real values
i sure did that...but i don't wanted to expose the ip adresses here ;)
other than that, not sure. Maybe try ##networking
do you think that this is the solution to redirect dns requests to a different port than 53 or shall i look for another solution?
i mean send....not redirect
It might be right but you probably should use the newly respected command: ip
what command?
ip
i dont understand
what do you mean?
There is a command called ip that can do what you want. See the manual with this command: man ip
ok...do you maybe know a site where this is explained with examples?
http://linux.die.net/man/8/ip
this is the manual...but i would need an example to understand how this works
ask in ##networking and explain your setup and what you want to do
ok, thx
